questions.question: He accumulated a fortune buying and selling used cars. Identify the noun.
questions.description: A noun refers to a person, place, thing or idea.

questions.question: The drawing of the house is accurate in every detail. Identify the adjective.
She has acquired a working knowledge of French. Identify the verb.
questions.description: Working is a present participle. Present participles are not verbs.

questions.question: He was criticized for one careless act. Identify the adjective.
questions.description: Careless modifies the noun act.

questions.question: Act now and save money during our annual sale. Identify the conjunction.
She is an acquisitive person, always wanting things. Identify the adverb.
A gentleman must conduct himself well in any situation. Identify the pronoun.
Addition is taught before subtraction. Identify the preposition.
The chameleon adapts to the surroundings by changing color. Identify the verb.
Let’s add up the cost of all our purchases. Identify the preposition.
All nations must work for the accomplishment of peace. Identify the adjective.
questions.description: All modifies the noun nations.

questions.question: I am an adult and I expect to be treated accordingly. Identify the adverb.
questions.description: Most words ending in ly are adverbs. Adverbs modify verbs, adjectives or other adverbs.

questions.question: That was a brilliant performance. Here performance is a/an ……………………..
questions.description: A noun is the name of a person, place, thing or idea.

questions.question: It has been a long time since I met him. Here since is a/an …………………….
questions.description: A conjunction is a word used to connect two words, phrases or clauses.

questions.question: Why do you have such a belligerent attitude? Here do is a/an ………………………..
Seasickness is an unusual ailment among experienced sailors. Here among is a/an ………………………….
The accident was attributed to faulty brakes. Here attributed is a/an ………………………..
questions.description: A verb is an action word.

questions.question: He is guilty of the awful crime of murder. Here murder is a/an …………………………
questions.description: A noun is a word expressing an idea or act.

questions.question: Germany, Italy and Japan formed an axis against the Allies in World War II. Here and is a/an …………………………….
questions.description: A conjunction is a connecting word.

questions.question: People who are too avid for success may miss some of the joys of life. Here too is a/an …………………………….
questions.description: Too is an adverb. Here it modifies the adjective avid.

questions.question: The audience eagerly awaited the speaker’s arrival. Here eagerly is a/an ……………………………
questions.description: Here the adverb eagerly modifies the verb awaited.

questions.question: The natives were awed when they saw their first airplane. Here their is a/an …………………………..
The scandal was an awkward situation for the entire family. Here entire is a/an ……………………….
questions.description: Here the adjective entire modifies the noun family.

questions.question: We had cheap seats in the balcony of the theatre. Here had is a/an ………………………
I was not expecting this from you. Identify the preposition.
She could not believe her eyes when she saw him there. Identify the verb.
questions.description: A verb is an action word.

questions.question: The girl sat beside her mother and kept talking. Identify the preposition
He was so angry that he shouted at the top of his voice. Identify the noun
questions.description: A noun is the name of a person, place, thing, quality or concept.

questions.question: It took me quite some time to get used to living in the city. Identify the adverb
questions.description: An adverb is a word that modifies a verb, adjective or another adverb.

questions.question: She was angry but she said nothing. Identify the adjective.
The teacher congratulated the students on their marvellous performance. Identify the adjective
questions.description: An adjective is a word that modifies a noun.

questions.question: She does not seem to understand the importance of keeping information confidential. Identify the adjective
Although buying is better than renting, few people can actually afford to buy a home these days. Identify the conjunction.
questions.description: A conjunction is a word used to connect two clauses.

questions.question: It cannot get better than this. Identify the verb
He injured his ankle while playing football yesterday. Identify the adverb
questions.description: Time words are adverbs.

questions.question: That child does not eat anything but hamburgers. Identify the adjective.
She had to move out of that tough ...................................
questions.description: We need a noun here.

questions.question: The townsfolk were quite ........................................... when we moved here.
questions.description: Neighborly means friendly.

questions.question: She is so ...................................... she jumps at the slightest noise.
questions.description: We use a noun or adjective as the complement of a verb of incomplete predication.

questions.question: He is charming ............................................. I don't quite trust him.
questions.description: Nevertheless is a transitional adverb. It is similar to however.

questions.question: She gave me a ............................................ answer.
questions.description: Noncommittal can mean indefinite or reserved.

questions.question: There will be a ................................................ charge for the lunch.
questions.description: Nominal can mean low or small.

questions.question: Paying taxes is ............................................
questions.description: Obligatory means compulsory or mandatory.

questions.question: It is hard to be polite to ........................................... people.
questions.description: Obtrusive means intrusive or interfering.

questions.question: The weather was good except for an .............................................. shower.
questions.description: Occasional is the adjective form.

questions.question: The youth's language was .........................................
questions.description: Offensive means insulting.

questions.question: Inflation will ........................................... the pay raise.
questions.description: Offset can mean nullify.

questions.question: New brooms sweep clean. Here clean is an ………………….
questions.description: Here clean modifies the verb sweep and hence it is an adverb.

questions.question: A burnt child dreads fire. Here burnt is an …………………….
questions.description: Burnt is used as an adjective because it modifies the noun child.

questions.question: The streets of some of our cities are noted for their crookedness. Here crookedness is a/an ………………………..
questions.description: Crookedness is an abstract noun.

questions.question: Talking too much is a sign of vanity. Here sign is a/an …………………………
questions.description: Sign is a noun. Only nouns can be used with articles.

questions.question: My views on this are quite different. Here quite is a/an ………………………….
questions.description: Here quite is an adverb because it modifies the adjective different.

questions.question: No man can serve two masters. Here serve is a/an ……………………
questions.description: Serve is a verb. Verbs are action words.

questions.question: Sam plays football very well. Here well is a/an …………………
questions.description: Here the word well modifies the verb plays. Adverbs are words used to modify verbs.

questions.question: The boy ran across the road. Here across is a ……………………..
questions.description: A preposition is a word that shows how the noun that follows it is connected to another word in the sentence.

questions.question: The cat was hiding behind the curtain. Here behind is a ………………………..
questions.description: A preposition is a word that shows how the noun that follows it is connected to another word in the sentence.

questions.question: I waited for him until he came. Here until is a …………………….
questions.description: A conjunction is a word used to connect two clauses.

questions.question: Rahim put the books on the table. Here put is a/an ……………………..
questions.description: Verbs are action words.

questions.question: She can speak English fluently. Here fluently is a/an ………………………
questions.description: Here the word fluently modifies the verb speaks. Adverbs are words used to modify verbs.

questions.question: The young woman kept the fast for 10 days. Here fast is a ……………..
questions.description: Here fast is the object of the verb kept. Only nouns can act as objects.

questions.question: Muslims fast during the month of Ramazan. Here fast is a/an ………………
questions.description: Verbs are action words.

questions.question: He is the right man for this job. Here right is a/an …………………..
questions.description: Here right modifies the noun man. Adjectives are words used to modify nouns.

questions.question: God shall defend the right. Here right is a/an ……………………
questions.description: Here the expression the right is the object of the verb defend.

questions.question: There is not much truth in what he says. Here much is a/an ………………
questions.description: Here much is an adjective because it modifies the noun truth.

questions.question: One day I met him at the library. Here one is a/an ……………….
questions.description: Here the adjective one modifies the noun day.

questions.question: One would think he was crazy. Here one is a/an …………………..
questions.description: Here one is the subject of the verb would think. Only nouns can be subjects.

questions.question: At last he came round to their views. Here round is a/an ………………….
questions.description: Here round is an adverb because it modifies the verb came.

questions.question: I have not seen him since that fateful day. Here since is a/an …………………..
He was poor so I helped him. Here so is a/an ………………….
questions.description: Here so is a conjunction because it connects the two clauses.

questions.question: He is so brave. Here so is a/an ………………
questions.description: Here so is an adverb because it modifies the adjective brave. Only adverbs can modify adjectives.

questions.question: Still waters run deep. Here still is a/an ………………..
questions.description: Here the word still modifies the noun waters. Only adjectives can modify nouns.

questions.question: This wood will make a good hiding place. Here hiding is a/an …………………….
questions.description: Adjectives are words used to modify nouns. Here the adjective hiding modifies the noun place.

questions.question: She was made to repeat the whole story. Here story is a/an …………………….
questions.description: A noun is the name of a person, place or thing.

questions.question: They lived many miles from the town. Which of the following is the preposition?
The government seems to change its mind a great deal. Here seems is a/an …………………………
questions.description: The verb is a word that explains what the subject is or what it does.

questions.question: In the two weeks in the job he made himself thoroughly disliked. Here thoroughly is a/an ………………………
questions.description: Most words ending in –ly are adverbs. Here the adverb thoroughly modifies the verb.

questions.question: Can you make me a birthday cake by Monday? Here me is a/an ……………………..
questions.description: A pronoun is a word used to refer to the speaker, the person spoken to or the person spoken of.

questions.question: Alice and James got married last week. Here last week is a/an ……………………..
questions.description: Words indicating time are usually adverbs.

questions.question: After three very unhappy years, they divorced. Here after is a/an ……………………
questions.description: A conjunction is a word used to connect two clauses.

questions.question: I have been married to you for twenty years and I still don’t understand you. Here twenty is a/an ……………………..
questions.description: Both ordinal and cardinal numbers are adjectives.

questions.question: I couldn’t think clearly, and I felt hot. Here felt is a/an …………………….
questions.description: Verbs are action words.

questions.question: The manager says that we may leave our coats in the bathroom. Here manager is a/an ……………………….
questions.description: A noun is the name of a person, place or thing.

questions.question: The rain made the grass wet. Here wet is a/an ………………………
questions.description: Adjectives are words that describe a quality.

questions.question: I have never had a better experience. Here 'never' is a/an .....................
She has always been a nuisance. Here nuisance is a/an ...................
I am tired of listening to his stupid instructions. Here stupid is a/an ...................
I am hoping to get a raise this year. Here 'this' is a/an ...................
To watch him eating really gets on my nerves. Here 'gets' is a/an .......................
It is nice to be sitting here with you. Here 'here' is a/an .........................
In spite of having a headache I enjoyed the movie. Here 'in spite of' is a/an ..................
He came to Chicago to look for work. Here 'work' is a/an .......................
There is a bus stop in front of the school. Here 'in front of' is a/an ......................
He was driving very fast indeed. Here 'was driving' is a/an ...................
She sat facing me across the table. Here 'across' is a/an ....................
I made them give me my money back. Here 'them' is a .....................
If you don’t want something, then it is expensive at any price.
He is as deaf as a post.
I change, but I cannot die.
He died that he might save his country.
May comes after April.
What annoys me most is his obstinacy.
He still lives in that house.
Suddenly one of the wheels came off.
Men who work hard enjoy their life fully.
Do not speak so loudly.
Right the wrong.
Do not talk like that.
The fool is busy in everyone’s business but his own.
I like this offer.
We are all waiting for the ——————— of the news.
Though the boy isn’t very intelligent, he is very ————————
The governor refused to accept the ————————- of the Chief Minister.
The students are all very ———————– about the picnic.
The committee’s proposal was not ——————- to the government.
India is a land of great cultural ———————-
Failure is the stepping stone to ——————
The government gave him ———————- to go abroad.
Film stars enjoy great ———————-
We must stop our ———————— on fossil fuels.
I want to go now. Here now is an ............................

He left ten minutes ago. Here ten is a/an ................................

Masons build houses. Here build is a/an ................................
Though she was unwell, she went to work. Here though is a/an ..............................
I have been reading since morning. Here morning is a/an .............................
He died two years ago. Here ago is a/an .................................
As she was late, we went without her. Here as is a/an ..............................
The Nile is the longest river in the world. Here Nile is a/an .....................................
What happened to you? Here you is a/an ...................................
My family live in different parts of India. Here different is a/an .................................
Gokhale was a great Indian ………….
From our freedom fighters we can learn many lessons in ………….
Greece and Rome have a …………….. past.
Many athletes are punished for using ……….
The patient is under ………..
For a miser spending his money can be quite ……………..
………… goes before a fall.
The minister’s ………… was accepted by the Governor.

While in England, Gokhale …………. theatres.
…………… breeds contempt.
Shivaji was a ………….. leader.

John is my best friend. Here John is a/an ........................................

My family live in different parts of India.  Here family is a/an ..........................................
That was a difficult question. Here difficult is a/an ...........................................
She was very impressed with her results. Here very is a/an ...............................................
Although she is poor, she is happy. Although is a/an ............................................
Have we bought enough chairs? Enough is a/an ..............................................
The policeman didn’t run fast enough to catch the thief.  Here fast is a/an .........................................
She thought of a wise plan. Thought is a ............................
That was a lovely evening. Lovely is a/an .......................................
My father works in a factory. Factory is a/an ...................................
She must be a stupid. Stupid is a/an .....................................
Selena is my best friend. Best is a/an ....................................
The dress was expensive still I bought it. Bought is a ....................................
The sun gives us heat and light. Gives is a/an ........................................
She went to the market to buy some vegetables. To is a/an ....................................
I helped him because I liked him. Because is a/an ...................................
Jasmines are white in color. White is a/an .....................................
The cat is under the bed. Under is a/an ...................................
